main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.preferences

Class UserlistValues

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.de.bsi.tsesimulator.preferences.UserlistValues

  • public class UserlistValues
extends java.lang.Object
    Used to read and write from and to the userlist.properties file located at the path given through the config.properties file. This is only necessary because this is a simulator, not an emulator or a real TSE and the simulator user might want to add or delete users from the TSE. This should never be used as an approach to the storage of user data by a real TSE.
    Another function of this file and class is to easily determine whether a user exists for the simulator or not.
    Since:
    1.0
    Version:
    1.5
    Author:
    dpottkaemper

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static UserlistValues getInstance()
                                  throws java.io.IOException
        Used to obtain the singleton instance of the user list values. Has to be used after PropertyValues.setPathToResourceDirectory(String), because PropertyValues builds the path to the user list file.
        Returns:
        the UserlistValues instance
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if loadUserlistFile() throws it, because no instance of UserlistValues existed prior to this call and the construction of the instance failed.

      • loadUserlistFile

        private void loadUserlistFile()
                       throws java.io.IOException
        Uses PropertyValues.getPathToUserlistProperties() to fetch the path where the user list file is stored. The file name is denoted by the value of ConfigConstants.CFG_TAG_PATH_TO_USERLIST_PROPERTIES in config.properties.
        Creates a BufferedInputStream on the file denoted by the value in config.properties, then reads the values stored in userlist.properties and closes the stream afterwards.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IOException occurs while reading the file userlist.properties or while using PropertyValues

      • getValue

        public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String key)
        Gets the value corresponding to the key it has received.
        Parameters:
        key - searches for the value corresponding to the key in the Properties object that is created by reading from the userlist.properties file
        Returns:
        the value corresponding to the key or null if userlist.properties does not contain such a key.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getAllPropertyNames

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllPropertyNames()
        Gets all the keys and packs them into a String Set.
        Returns:
        a set containing all the keys currently associated with this UserlistValues instance.
        Since:
        1.0

      • containsKey

        public boolean containsKey(java.lang.String key)
        Checks if the String key is used as a key
        Parameters:
        key - the supposed key as a String
        Returns:
        true, if the key String is used as a key in userlist.properties

      • getNumberOfKeyValuePairs

        public int getNumberOfKeyValuePairs()
        calculates the number of key-value-pairs based on the size of the Set returned by getAllPropertyNames().
        Returns:
        the number of key-value-pairs stored in userlist.properties

      • addUserAndRole

        public void addUserAndRole(java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.String value)
                    throws UserAlreadyExistsException,
                           AddingUserFailedException
        Attempts to add a new key-value-pair to the userlist.properties file. Checks if the key already exists and if the role is one of the two permitted roles. If adding the pair was successful, the instance of UserlistValues is reloaded, to reflect the changes and make them accessible to the simulator.
        Because of a dependency on the existence of a UserlistValues instance, it is recommended that the caller of this function also calls UserlistValues#setPathToConfigProperties(String) first.
        Parameters:
        key - new user-id to be added to the list.
        value - the role associated with this user-id.
        Throws:
        UserAlreadyExistsException - if attempting to add an already existing user to the simulator
        AddingUserFailedException - if updating userlist.properties fails, most likely due to an IOException

      • writeToPropertiesFile_Add

        private void writeToPropertiesFile_Add(java.lang.String key,
                                       java.lang.String value)
                                throws java.io.IOException
        Writes an added key-value pair to the userlist.properties file.
        Parameters:
        key - the user to be written to userlist.properties
        value - the role of that user to be written to userlist.properties
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if writing to the file fails

      • removeUserAndRole

        public void removeUserAndRole(java.lang.String key,
                              java.lang.String value)
                       throws RemovingUserFailedException
        Attempts to remove a key-value-pair from the userlist.properties file. Checks if the key exists and the role is one of the two permitted roles. If removing the pair was successful, the instance of UserlistValues is reloaded, to reflect the changes and make them accessible to the simulator.
        Parameters:
        key - user-id to be removed from the list.
        value - the role associated with this user-id.
        Throws:
        RemovingUserFailedException - if attempting to remove a user from the simulator that does not exist or who does not have the role specified. Is also thrown, if updating userlist.properties fails, most likely due to an IOException.

      • writeToPropertiesFile_Delete

        private void writeToPropertiesFile_Delete(java.lang.String key,
                                          java.lang.String value)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the removal of a key-value pair to the userlist.properties file.
        Parameters:
        key - the user to be removed from userlist.properties
        value - the role of that user
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if writing to the file fails
